metadata.Title: CVE-2017-5992 on Ubuntu 20.04 ESM (focal) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Openpyxl 2.4.1 resolves external entities by default, which allows remote attackers to conduct XXE attacks via a crafted .xlsx document. It was discovered that openpyxl incorrectly handled certain documents. A remote attacker could possibly use this issue to cause a denial of service or other unspecified impact.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-5992` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

python-openpyxl - 2.4.9-1
python3-openpyxl - 2.4.9-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: openpyxl package in focal, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2.4.9-1').
